AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Raymond McMillon: defendant, appellant, and passenger in a tractor-trailer with undocumented aliens, convicted of alien transportation offenses, traveled with co-defendant to Laredo, questioned by Agent Pena at an immigration checkpoint, filed a motion to dismiss the indictment on speedy trial grounds, sentenced to 41 months' imprisonment, argues about the lawfulness of Agent Pena's immigration questions, claimed to have a possessory interest in the tractor-trailer due to a commercial purpose, appealed the district court's factual findings, had his speedy trial clock begin on July 8, 2014, and filed multiple motions to continue, including a motion to suppress and a motion for discovery of canine records, filed a motion to dismiss the indictment
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Zeba Williams: co-defendant, driver of the tractor-trailer, asked McMillon to accompany him to pick up commercial equipment, questioned by Agent Pena at an immigration checkpoint, gave consent for search of tractor's sleeper area, testified about the events during the suppression hearing, voluntarily consented to the search
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Raymond McMillon and Zeba Williams: pair who traveled together from Houston to San Antonio and then to Laredo, questioned by Agent Pena at an immigration checkpoint, defendants in the case who requested continuances to file pretrial motions
